BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames Class

Definition

Animates the value of a property that takes a Boolean along a set of stem.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames.KeyFrames* over a specified stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.Duration*.

In this Article

[System.Windows.Markup.ContentProperty("KeyFrames")]
public class BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames : System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanAnimationBase, System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild, System.Windows.Media.Animation.IKeyFrameAnimation

Remarks

A key frame animation's target values are defined by its KeyFrames property, which contains a collection of BooleanKeyFrame objects. Each BooleanKeyFrame defines a segment of the animation with its own target Value and KeyTime. When the animation runs, it progresses from one key value to the next at the specified key times.

Constructors

BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames()

Initializes a new instance of the BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames class.

public BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames ();

Properties

KeyFrames

Gets or sets the collection of BooleanKeyFrame objects that define the animation.

public System.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanKeyFrameCollection KeyFrames { get; set; }
Value
BooleanKeyFrameCollection

The collection of BooleanKeyFrame objects that define the animation. The default value is stem.Windows.Media.Animation.BooleanKeyFrameCollection.Empty*.

Methods

AddChild(Object)

Adds a child BooleanKeyFrame to this BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames.

protected virtual void AddChild (object child);
child
Object

The object to be added as the child of this BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The parameter child is not a BooleanKeyFrame.

Remarks

This method allows BooleanKeyFrame objects to be direct children of a BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames object in markup.

AddText(String)

Adds a text string as a child of this BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames.

protected virtual void AddText (string childText);
childText
String

The text added to the BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

A BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames does not accept text as a child, so this method will raise this exception unless a derived class has overridden this behavior which allows text to be added.

Remarks

A BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames does not accept text as a child, so this method will raise an InvalididOperationException unless a derived class has overridden this behavior which allows text to be added.

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see Clone.

FreezeCore(Boolean)

Makes this instance of BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames object unmodifiable or determines whether it can be made unmodifiable..

protected override bool FreezeCore (bool isChecking);
isChecking
Boolean

true if this method should simply determine whether this instance can be frozen. false if this instance should actually freeze itself when this method is called.

Returns
Boolean

If isChecking is true, this method returns true if this object can be made read-only, or false if it cannot be made read-only. If isChecking is false, this method returns true if this object is now read-only, or false if it cannot be made read-only, with the side effect of having begun to change the frozen status of this object.

GetAsFrozenCore(Freezable)

Makes this instance a clone of the specified BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames object.

protected override void GetAsFrozenCore (System.Windows.Freezable source);
source
Freezable

The BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames object to be cloned.

Remarks

When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values. Note that if these properties contain resource references or data bindings, GetAsFrozen will fail when trying to freeze the object and will throw an InvalidOperationException.

This method is called by the GetAsFrozen method and should not be called directly from your code, except when calling the base implementation while overriding this method. To create a frozen copy of the current object, call GetAsFrozen instead of calling this method directly.

For more information, see GetAsFrozenCore.

To create a frozen copy of the current object, call GetCurrentValueAsFrozen instead of calling this method directly.

For more information see GetCurrentValueAsFrozenCore.

GetCurrentValueCore(Boolean,Boolean,AnimationClock)

Calculates a value that represents the current value of the property being animated, as determined by this instance of BooleanAnimationUsingKeyFrames.

protected override sealed bool GetCurrentValueCore (bool defaultOriginValue, bool defaultDestinationValue, System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock animationClock);
defaultOriginValue
Boolean

The suggested origin value, used if the animation does not have its own explicitly set start value.

defaultDestinationValue
Boolean

The suggested destination value, used if the animation does not have its own explicitly set end value.

animationClock
AnimationClock

An AnimationClock that generates the stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentTime* or stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentProgress* used by the host animation.

Returns
Boolean

The calculated value of the property, as determined by the current instance.

Remarks

If the defaultOriginValue is the first in the composition chain, this value will be the snapshot value (if one is available) or the base property value; otherwise this value will be the value returned by the previous animation in the chain with an AnimationClock that is not Stopped.

The defaultDestinationValue is the base value if the animation is in the first composition layer of animations on a property; otherwise the value is the output value from the previous composition layer of animations for the property.

GetNaturalDurationCore(Clock)

Provide a custom natural Duration when the Duration property is set to stem.Windows.Duration.Automatic*.

protected override sealed System.Windows.Duration GetNaturalDurationCore (System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock clock);
clock
Clock

The Clock whose natural duration is desired.

Returns
Duration

If the last key frame of this animation is a KeyTime, then this value is used as the stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.NaturalDuration*; otherwise it will be one second.

Returns
Boolean

true if the property value should be serialized; otherwise, false.
